data.description:
- Explore a snowy mountain valley on a hang glider. 
- A relaxing flight through this stunning landscape with frozen lakes and forests. 
- Use boost rings and thermals for a longer flight.
- Try to find a mysterious crash site.

Three control modes:
- Hanging: Just like in a real hang glider, use your body to control the flight.
- Lying: Use the movement of your hands to control the flight.
- Sitting: Use the combined movements of your body and hands to control the flight.

Safety (Hanging control mode):
- Do not use open hooks, lateral movements can cause the rig to come loose from the hook, use carabiners instead.
- Do not use chairs with wheels, a wheel could lock sideways and overturn the chair.
- Do not use improvised or poorly fixed bars.
- Wrap the bar with foam and use a mattress below your body.
- Never use handrails in high places as a bar.
- It is recommended that you always have someone close to help in any situation.

This project was developed from the classic Unreal Landscape Mountains Showcase. 
All credits to the talented team at Epic Games related to the original project. (The original project is available for free at the Unreal Marketplace.)

changelog.change_log:
New experimental features:
- A new control mode: Seated (Combines body and hand movement)
- A rudimentary dynamic shadow
- A simple thermal system  (look for rising particles or small low clouds.)
- Option to turn ring boosters and thermals on and off.
- New takeoff points.
Fix:
- Graphical glitch around lake shores when viewed from a distance.

- Fixed Hand Tracking skipping issue.
- Fixed graphical glitches at the edges of the screen.
- Adjusted the hang glider's center of mass to a more realistic position.
- New control mode using Hand Tracking (Experimental).

- Quest 3 90hz.
- Automatic adjustment of the longitudinal center of mass, allowing  to switch between users of different heights without having to re-center and reposition the hang glider, this adjustment is calculated during the countdown.
- The experience now starts from a wooden platform on the mountain.
- Fixed visual bug with the sensitivity bar in the menu.
